intro: Allium valdecallosum, commonly known as the Sierra Valley garlic, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. The plant features bulbous stems and narrow, grass-like leaves, with small white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
